review: I have both the Apple TV and Google Chromecast and I love both for their different features.  With Apple TV and it's in built app, you don't need a computer or a phone to control it, unlike chromecast. However I mirror my computer and use my phone to my tv regularly.  I also found a way to stream my videos from my comp to the apple tv and get 5.1 sound (Air Video HD app, $2).  Apple tv also has new apps that I enjoy - more tv stations etc.With my chromecast, I love their newer apps, some of which are not supported by Apple TV (including comedy central, encore and starz). I also found mirroring the browser tab to the chromecast much smoother than mirroring my laptop screen to the apple tv. Particularly when mirroring online videos and clips, the chromecast does it much easier. Also, I can just cast one tab or video and work on other stuff in other tabs or my computer.  Finally, there's also a way to cast your computer videos/movies to the chromecast (videostream app or Plex, both free), which can be in HD, however, I haven't found a way to get a get 5.1 sound... to be continued.With all Chromecast features and $32 price tag, 5 stars! Highly recommended
